item.title: By: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.dc:creator: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.description: I've seen another side affect of job protection in my previous company. We had a collegue with great knowledge about virtualization but he didn't share any information with coworkers. So nobody knew the setup and configuration of the customer he was responsible for. Virtualization suddenly became very popular and the company decided to put a virtualization team together. The guy applied for the job as teamleader but management told him he had the knowledge and was the companies first choice but because of the lack of documentation and shared knowledge on his projects it would take too long to replace him. So somebody new was hired for the team leader job. I still remember the glaze stare in his eyes after his talk. Couple of days later we received a message that the guy wouldn't come to work for some time, he had a burn-out...
